clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Complications, Quality of Life and Easiness of Use of Implantable Central Venous Access Ports
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Complications, Quality of Life and Easiness of Use of Implantable Central Venous Access Ports : Cohort and Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, descriptive and observational study of the anticancer center practice

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and collection of complications for the patients requiring an implantable central venous access ports substitution/change
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until the implantable central venous access ports removal

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief description of the different risk factor for morbidity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until the implantable central venous access ports removal

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the implantable central venous access ports ease-of-use for nurses according to the modalities of implementation and patient features
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until the implantable central venous access ports removal

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the patient quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before central venous access ports implementation, at the first day of chemotherapy, and during the cycle 4 of chemotherapy

arm_group.description: Patient with cancer requiring a long-term central venous catheter

study_pop.textblock: All the patients requiring the implementation of a catheter in an anticancerous center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with any cancer, requiring a central venous catheter
- No contraindication for any surgery with local or complete anaesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous Xylocaine or Lidocaine allergy
- Clinic superior vena cava syndrome

clinical_study.keyword: Implantable central venous access ports, cancer
